channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/cDNnuB76TS
ARK Investment Management has lost 27% this month, leaving many recent purchasers underwater https://t.co/IkUYihrvvL
Two thirds of nurses surveyed last year said the pandemic prompted them to reconsider their careers. The resulting burnout has left many wondering why they still do it. https://t.co/CgD2XtcOGC
Cincinnati came back from down 21-3 to beat Patrick Mahomes and Kansas City and give the franchise a shot at its first-ever Super Bowl win https://t.co/xvblXCePGT
The Cincinnati Bengals upset the Kansas City Chiefs 27-24 in overtime to advance to the Super Bowl https://t.co/a3baYyCppY
Obituary: For five decades, David Cox was one of the few rock stars in the world of statistics. https://t.co/TlLvDBD6Xb

From @WSJopinion: Racial inequality narrowed on Trump’s watch, and much of the media were too busy agitating against him to take note or give credit where due, writes @jasonrileywsj https://t.co/DwGa8s1dYf
Bipartisan legislation aimed at striking the Russian economy if President Vladimir Putin invades Ukraine is nearing completion in the U.S. Senate https://t.co/HlVQpivVGa
Drugmakers raised prices on 866 prescription medicines by an average of 6.6% early this year as lawmakers explore measures to curb high costs https://t.co/LHuGpepEzw
If you were born after 1980, the monetary tightening that the Fed says will begin in March will be unlike any you’ve seen https://t.co/IRmG6GkFq6
The Omicron variant spreads so quickly and generally causes such a mild form of illness among vaccinated populations that countries are tolerating greater Covid-19 outbreaks https://t.co/LStgGnEaub
From @WSJopinion: Vaccines were wasted on those who didn’t need them, and people who posed no risk lost jobs, writes @MartyMakary https://t.co/tZd2lDxeMz
It’s about to get a lot easier to find out what jobs in New York City pay, and employers aren’t happy https://t.co/Gx9Di1UN1h

NFTs and sneakers have a lot in common: They come in limited quantities, depend on sky-high demand and stir speculative crazes in the resale market. It may be a perfect fit for the two to come together. https://t.co/sjQGE90Rio

Rafael Nadal roared back from two sets down to win the Australian Open and stands alone atop men’s tennis with 21 major titles. Sports columnist @jasongay on the Spaniard’s stunning victory: https://t.co/rfiAdZRRQy
Tens of thousands of people protesting Canada’s Covid-19 restrictions and mandates clogged the streets of Ottawa on Saturday. Even Elon Musk weighed in. https://t.co/COOK8NMOsw
Rafael Nadal overcame Russia's Daniil Medvedev in a grueling five-hour final to win the Australian Open, becoming the first man to claim 21 Grand Slam titles https://t.co/sMabdErrU4

Facebook says it’s helping millions of the world’s poorest people get online through programs that allow them free data. Many of these people end up being charged, collectively, an estimated millions of dollars a month. https://t.co/31mtdmROkT

North Korea launched a suspected ballistic missile off its east coast, its seventh weapons launch this month—more than it had conducted in all of last year. The regime’s testing pace has never been this high. https://t.co/AcwnHkZpDx

Italy is making life difficult for the unvaccinated. For one holdout, that means flying via Spain to reach a domestic destination. Another, seeking to return to work, chose deliberate infection over a shot. https://t.co/MDtaPTaFd4
Slash talks about reconciling with Axl Rose, future Guns N’ Roses music and his new solo album https://t.co/L11MuTzzaW

“Don’t Mention Bruno” in Russian, “Secret Bruno” in Japanese and “Just Not a Word About Bruno” in German. How Disney translated the song “We Don’t Talk About Bruno” from "Encanto." https://t.co/PaOwxqXAZV
Tom Brady is retiring after 22 seasons, reports say. He won 7 Super Bowls in a career that established the 44-year-old as the greatest quarterback in history. https://t.co/aAcmACegxW
From @WSJopinion: If Biden chooses a radical to replace Breyer, it will stimulate GOP turnout in November, writes @KimStrassel https://t.co/GRwELFmZlp

Elon Musk wants McDonald’s to start accepting dogecoin for payment. The Tesla CEO has repeatedly touted the cryptocurrency, saying his company would accept it for payment for some merchandise. https://t.co/XM1OacqztD

Texas GOP Gov. Greg Abbott is being blamed for bungling the deployment of thousands of National Guard troops to the border. “I’ve never seen the magnitude of problems of Operation Lone Star.” https://t.co/dIuNbbq1nl
Take a look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/sBcre8Fi1b https://t.co/pUH6O84A4A
Ukraine is building local defense forces to take on Russia’s military if it breaches front-line defenses, with brigades of reservists in every region https://t.co/Gy6Gsf25c1
Women's tennis No. 1 Ashleigh Barty defeated the U.S.'s Danielle Collins in two sets to become the first home winner of the Australian Open since 1978 https://t.co/7vNdy9ZZUj

Pandemic demand is depleting stocks of Crown Royal whisky, Lagavulin Scotch and Don Julio tequila, Diageo said. These bestselling brands can take months or years to age before hitting liquor-store shelves, making it hard to quickly increase production. https://t.co/LUkQOpv2m7
Subjected to U.S. sanctions under Taliban rule, Afghanistan faces a humanitarian disaster, with 1 million children in danger of dying from malnutrition https://t.co/spT4VNlxKW
Habitual late riser @jasongay has discovered the strange joy of waking up at 4 a.m. It’s not for everyone, but it’s working for him. https://t.co/vasrV6rHvq
Employers spent 4% more on compensation last year, an increase not seen since 2001, as they competed for workers in a tight labor market https://t.co/f8W827M6p9
Joni Mitchell is removing all of her music from Spotify in a move supporting Neil Young’s crusade against what he deems misinformation spread on Joe Rogan’s podcast. https://t.co/OQPY2pXvSw
If you were born after 1980, the monetary tightening that the Fed says will begin in March will be unlike any you’ve seen https://t.co/GTh8jHvIP4
The Bidens have a new pet cat in the White House, a 2-year-old Tabby named Willow https://t.co/DfdkupxXfe
A snow-covered bridge in Pittsburgh collapsed Friday morning, as the city prepared for a visit from President Biden centered on infrastructure https://t.co/YczH9wXxtE
A federal judge blocked an oil and gas lease sale of 80 million acres in the Gulf of Mexico, saying U.S. regulators used flawed environmental analysis https://t.co/PAGvBogjXC
Essay: When Beijing shut down a pro-democracy newspaper in Hong Kong, it gave the world a glimpse of the future it hopes to create https://t.co/DoMoPLmEEk
“I want to bring your attention to what I believe is Twitter’s unwitting complicity in curbing free and fair speech in India,” Mr. Gandhi wrote in the letter to Twitter's CEO https://t.co/86A2eCuXHF
The U.S. called for a meeting of the U.N. Security Council to discuss the standoff over Ukraine, an effort to apply international pressure on Russia to negotiate https://t.co/RXyOqo9fpN
SiriusXM revived Neil Young’s radio channel after Spotify refused to cut Joe Rogan’s lucrative podcast, and other streamers promoted the folk-rocker https://t.co/lcEwxTEBIc

A Sandro Botticelli portrait of Jesus Christ with bloodshot eyes and a halo of tiny, weeping angels sold for $45.4 million on Thursday in the latest sign of the art market’s resilience https://t.co/mrwylpK1ac
Three shots of vaccine cut the risk of death from Covid-19 by 95% in those age 50 and older during the Omicron surge in the U.K. https://t.co/nOow0XstQT
Virginia has set up an email hotline where parents can send complaints about what Gov. Glenn Youngkin has called “divisive teaching practices” such as critical race theory https://t.co/SkwhW7rCO9

Eight years after Russia seized Ukraine’s Crimean peninsula and fomented war in the country’s east, Kyiv’s once-feeble military is bigger and better armed. It is still far outgunned by Moscow. https://t.co/AJ0fpC9hSB
Europe is enlisting the U.S. to help secure more energy supplies in case a conflict in Ukraine interrupts the flow of natural gas from Russia https://t.co/Aga5EEe5jF

From @WSJopinion: Politicians and public-health officials owe an apology to Americans who lost their jobs on the false premises that only unvaccinated people could spread the virus and only vaccination could prevent its spread, writes @MartyMakary https://t.co/olwVpnZ981
China’s foreign minister warned Washington against doing anything to hype up the Ukraine-Russia crisis https://t.co/oF8iMedspM

Spotify took down Neil Young’s music after the folk-rock star asked that it be removed over what he said is fake information about Covid-19 vaccines being spread on the platform through Joe Rogan’s podcast #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/UD1xXj975x https://t.co/0enDtAIOFu
